intro: Cyclostemon subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cyclostemon, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features include smooth, bark-like stems and yellowish-green flowers that are often grouped in cyathium structures. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
